page.title: 18Language - Yardley
page.content: As far as we could discover the main language spoken in our area is English.A few families belong to an ethnic minority. However,these expressions appear to be peculiar to East Birmingham's youth. 1.Chip-head:Someone with greasy hair. 2.Cuffy:An untidy person or tramp. 3.Extra:To be outrageous in behaviour. 4.Gibbo:Someone with prominent teeth. 5.Grass-up:to report someone to the higher authorities. 6.Have a Benny:Throw a fit of temper. 7.Level:Stop being so outrageous/be quiet! 8.Main lads:Boastful youths who swagger around feeling superior. 9.Roz:Someone with a large nose. 10.Slap-head:Someone with no hair. 11.Sound as a pound:Everything going well.
